conversation.message: Dear School_C Admissions, I’m Student_B. School_C is one of my top choices, and I’m excited about the opportunity to join your community. I would like to formally apply and would be honored to accept a seat if offered. [APPLY]
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_A, but I have low priority there (4th), so applying immediately risks rejection if higher-priority students apply. At School_C, I am ranked 1st in their priority list, making acceptance highly likely if I apply now. Since School_C is still 3rd on my true preference list and a secure match is valuable early, I will apply to School_C to lock in a strong outcome rather than gamble on School_A.

conversation.message: Dear Student_B, thank you for your application and your interest in School_C. We are pleased to offer you admission to School_C and would be excited to welcome you to our community. [ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: Student_B is #1 on School_C’s true priority list. We have quota 1 and also received an application from Student_E (ranked #4). Accepting Student_B immediately secures our top-choice match and avoids the risk of losing them to School_A/School_B (both ranked above School_C in Student_B’s preferences). Therefore, accept Student_B now.

conversation.message: Dear School_C Admissions, I’m Student_E and School_C is my first-choice school. I’m applying because I strongly value your academic environment and would be ready to commit and enroll if accepted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_C. Although School_C ranks me 4th, applying immediately gives me the best chance before higher-priority students fill the single seat. I will make a clear, committed application emphasizing fit and readiness to enroll if accepted.

conversation.message: Dear Student_E, thank you for your application and for sharing that School_C is your first choice. At this time, we have already filled our available seat, so we are unable to offer you admission. We appreciate your strong interest in School_C and wish you the very best in your placement process.
conversation.thought: We have quota 1 and already matched with Student_B via mutual APPLY/ACCEPT in the history; current remaining quota is 0, so we must reject any further APPLY messages. Even though Student_E ranks School_C first, School_C’s true priority list ranks Student_B above Student_E, and the match with Student_B is already established, so we cannot consider Student_E without violating the quota constraint.

conversation.message: Hello School_B admissions—I'm Student_C and I’m applying because School_B is my first choice. I’m very motivated to join your community and would commit fully if admitted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B. I have relatively strong priority there (3rd), behind Student_E and Student_B. To maximize my chance at my highest true preference, I should apply immediately rather than spend a round talking, since capacities are 1 and early acceptance matters.

conversation.message: Student_C, thank you for your application and for naming School_B as your first choice. We’re pleased to offer you admission to School_B. We look forward to having you join our community.
conversation.thought: As School_B, my true priority ranks Student_C (3rd) above Student_D and Student_A, but below Student_E and Student_B. In this round, I have applications from Student_C and Student_A; accepting Student_C would secure a relatively high-priority match and fill my only seat immediately. However, Student_E is my top priority and lists School_B last, so is unlikely to apply; Student_B ranks School_B second and may apply if not accepted by School_A, so there is some chance to do better by waiting. Given the uncertainty of Student_B applying and the risk of losing Student_C to another school (Student_C also ranks School_C second, and School_C ranks Student_C 2nd), it is safer to lock in Student_C now rather than gamble for Student_B. Therefore, accept Student_C.

conversation.message: Hello School_B admissions team—I'm Student_A and I’m formally applying. School_B is my first-choice school, and I would gladly accept a seat if offered. Thank you for considering my application. [APPLY]
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B, so I should apply immediately. Although School_B ranks me last in its priority list, delaying would not improve my chances and could only remove the (small) possibility that higher-priority students choose other schools. I will submit a clear, committed application now.

conversation.message: Student_A, thank you for your application and for placing School_B as your first choice. At this time, we have already filled our available seat and are unable to offer you admission in this round. We appreciate your interest and wish you the best with your other applications.
conversation.thought: Our quota is already filled (0 remaining) with Student_C from this round’s accepted application. Per rules, we must reject any further [APPLY] when quota is 0. Even though Student_A is on our true priority list, we cannot accept without capacity; no mechanism for swapping is provided here, so we reject and encourage them to pursue other choices.

conversation.message: Dear School_A Admissions, I’m Student_D. School_A is one of my top choices, and I’m excited about the chance to join a rigorous program where I can contribute both academically and to school activities. If admitted, I would be ready to commit and make School_A my home for the next three years. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B, but School_B’s priority ranks me 4th (behind E, B, C). Since others (A, C) also rank School_B highly, an immediate [APPLY] is likely to be rejected if higher-priority students apply. To maximize my final outcome, I should target the highest school where I have a strong acceptance chance: School_A ranks me 2nd (behind E), and several students rank School_A #1 or #3, but only Student_E outranks me there. Applying early to School_A can lock in a high option (3rd on my list) rather than risking ending up much lower after losing contests at B/C.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_D,

Thank you for your thoughtful application and for your strong interest in School_A. We’re pleased to offer you admission, and we appreciate your readiness to commit to our community.

We look forward to welcoming you to School_A.

Sincerely,
School_A Admissions
conversation.thought: School_A has quota 1 and true priority ranks Student_E above Student_D. However, only Student_D has applied this round. Accepting now secures a high-priority candidate (2nd on our list) and avoids the risk of ending unmatched if Student_E never applies or matches elsewhere (Student_E ranks School_A third, behind School_C and School_D). Given the binding nature of acceptance and the uncertainty of receiving Student_E, it is optimal to accept Student_D.

conversation.message: Hello School_E admissions team—I'm Student_A. I’m submitting my formal application to School_E. If offered admission, I will accept and enroll. Thank you for your consideration. [APPLY]
conversation.thought: Only School_D and School_E remain unmatched. On my true preference list, School_E (4th) is ranked higher than School_D (5th), so I should prioritize applying to School_E now. I also have the highest priority at School_E (they rank Student_A first), which makes acceptance very likely if the seat is still open. Therefore I will submit a clear, committed application to School_E.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_A,

Thank you for your application to School_E. We are pleased to offer you admission. We look forward to welcoming you to our community.

[ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: Student_A is my top-ranked student on School_E’s true priority list. I have remaining quota 1 and only Student_A has applied this round. Accepting secures my best possible match and avoids the risk of losing them to other schools in later rounds.

conversation.message: Dear School_D Admissions Committee, I’m Student_E. After learning that my first-choice option is no longer available, I’m reaching out because School_D is my next top choice and a place where I believe I would thrive. I’m especially drawn to your academic rigor and the chance to contribute positively to the school community. If admitted, I am ready to commit and enroll. Thank you very much for your consideration.
conversation.thought: School_C (my top choice) already rejected me due to a filled seat. Among the remaining unmatched schools, School_D is my next highest true preference (2nd), so I should apply immediately rather than risk losing the single seat. I will signal strong fit and clear intent to enroll if accepted.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your thoughtful message and for your interest in School_D. We appreciate your commitment and the reasons you shared for wanting to join our community.

We are pleased to offer you admission to School_D. We look forward to welcoming you and supporting you in our academic program and school life.

Sincerely,
School_D Admissions
conversation.thought: School_D has quota 1 and true priority order: Student_D > Student_A > Student_C > Student_E > Student_B. Student_E is acceptable but ranks 4th. In this round, only Student_E applied. Given the market info, Student_D and Student_A both rank School_D last, and Student_C ranks School_D 3rd; they are unlikely to apply soon (especially since other schools rank them higher). However, holding out risks ending unmatched. Since Student_E is within the acceptable list and is explicitly ready to commit, accepting secures a match now rather than speculating about low-probability higher-priority applicants.
